result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Patterson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles E Patterson in court with attorney Daniel McMurray for Nicholas K. Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing argument by the State and Atty. McMurray.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

12 months Jail STRAIGHT TIME (Credit - 6 days)

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:

- Perform  20 hours of community service each year of probation with the 20 hours in the 2nd year of probation be completed by 2-28-17;
- Take a Cognitive Thinking Course that includes victim empathy within first 12 months of probation;
- Obtain a valid license within 3 months of probation;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with co-actors,  victims residence and Lisa L. .


Costs: $278.00 BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00  BAIL TO APPLY
DNA SAMPLE WAIVED.
Remaining bail to be refunded to poster

Condition Time: 120 days Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Pretrial incarceration credit.
Sentencing hearing on April 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
